column14: Description

column2: Research: GitHub API vs. MySql Database

column14:
Description: As a page designer, I should have some template pages created before settling on a design.

Acceptance Criteria: 
1. Two mock-pages created for both a home page and rule page.
2. Present the pages to the project lead.

Description: As a developer, I need the right technology for managing my site.

Acceptance Criteria:
1. Files are formatted and organized towards the criteria of the technology.
2. Pages display properly upon integration.

Description: As a developer I need to have my database working so that I can call items onto a page.

Acceptance Criteria: 
1. Rules are stored on Git-Hub.
2. The application is linked up to Github.

Description: As a developer, I need a diagram made for mapping out the site as well as its functions.

Acceptance Criteria: 
1. A software created diagram that shows which pages connect to which and how they are related.

Description: As a back-end developer, I need to be able to understand the technology we are using to store our data.

Acceptance Criteria:
1. A 2-3 page document describing the usage of GitHub as a content manager (controller) and database.

Description: As a project owner, I need to be able to know what is the best hosting service out there for the state of the product now and after completion.

Acceptance Criteria: 
1. A 2-3 page research document describing possible hosting services and how the benefit the project as a private app and a public one.

Description: As a site developer, I need a page for users to go to when they first enter the site.

Acceptance Criteria: 
1. A page created, using the bootstrap framework with a welcome/ about message, and a placeholder box/ boxes for recommended games.

Description: As a user I need to be able to login to the application using my email and password.

Acceptance Criteria: 
1. Both the email and password are checked to see if they exist in the database, and the user is sent back home page, if they do. 
2. If the login fails, the the page is reloaded.

Description: As a user of the site, I need to be able to sign up for my account.

Acceptance Criteria:
1. The page is made with the bootstrap framework and has a design that is thematically consistent with the rest of the site.
2. The page has a box with a form.
3. The form has an input for email, password, and a button to submit. 
4. The page has text next to the "submit" button that leads to a login page.

column2: Design: Sign-Up and Login Page Page Templates
column18:
Description: As a page designer, I should have some template pages created before settling on a design.

Acceptance Criteria: 
1. Two mock-pages created for both a sign up and login page.
2. Present the pages to the project lead. (Wyatt Derk - Nov 20, 2018)

column2: Develop: Login and Sign-In Error Checking
column14:
Description: As a user, I need to have the page tell me if I am using an incorrect email and password for the login and an invalid email for the sign-up.

Acceptance Criteria:
1. Any error is highlighted in red and will have a message displaying the potential problem.
2. The sign-up form checks to see if the email used is an email format. 
3. The login page tells the user that an incorrect email or password is used when one of the two fails.

Description: As a user, I need a functioning form to make an account with my email and password.

Acceptance Criteria: 
1. Upon clicking the "submit" button, both the email and password are sent to the database. 
2. The user is sent to the home page.

Description: As a developer, I need to have my site track the status of my user from each page.

Acceptance Criteria: 
1. Session checking added to each page.
2. Sessions enable site to remember that a user is logged in on any page.

As a developer, I need to be able to display rules on the page from the database.

Acceptance Criteria:
1. A rule set of any game of choice is displayed on the rule page.
2. The page is generated with an extension number of the database id.
3. The query is successfully made using the GitHub API.

Description: As a user, I want to be able to look for rules relating to expansion packs. 

Acceptance Criteria:
1. The page is made with the bootstrap framework and has a design that is thematically consistent with the rest of the site.
2. The page contains some boxes for expansion packs.
3. Each box contains a title and image for the expansion pack.

Description: As a user of the site, I need to be able to login to my account.

Acceptance Criteria:
1. The page is made with the bootstrap framework and has a design that is thematically consistent with the rest of the site.
2. The page has a box with a form.
3. The form has an input for email, password, and a button to login. 
4. The page has text next to the "login" button that leads to a sign-up page.

Description: As a user, I want a page where I can read the rules for the game I am looking for as well as be able to search for them.

Acceptance Criteria: 
1. The page is made with bootstrap and is thematically consistent with the rest of the site. 
2. The page contains an area where the rules will be loaded in.
3. The page contains a search bar for looking up a rule by keyword.

Description: As a user,  I need page that displays the search results for when I look up a game on the search bar.

Acceptance Criteria: 
1. The page is made with the bootstrap framework and is thematically similar to the rest of the site.
2. The page has a placeholder box for no results found and for a result.

column2: Design/ Develop: Login Changing to Profile when Logged-in
column14:
Description: As a user, I want to have the login text change to my profile name on the nav-bar so that I can know that I am logged-in and go to my profile page.

Acceptance Criteria:
1. When a user is not logged in, the nav-bar should display the text "Login" and should go to the login page.
2. When the user is logged in, the text should say the profile name, and direct the user to the profile page.

Description: As a developer, I need a page that acts as a hub for all game related pages.

Acceptance Criteria: 
1. A page that contains links to the rules, add-on content, and questions. 
2. The page is thematically consistent with the rest of the site.
3. The page is bootstrap compatible.

Description: As a user, I need a nav-bar so that I will be able to  navigate to different pages.

Acceptance Criteria: 
1. A separate file created for storing the nav-bar. 
2. A bootstrap compatible nav-bar. 
3. Title of the site that goes to the home page, Login, a popular games dropdown, and a search bar.
4. Text that links to other pages, should highlight when hovered over.

column2: Design: Home and Rule Page Template
column14:
Description: As a page designer, I should have some template pages created before settling on a design.

Acceptance Criteria: 
1. Two mock-pages created for both a home page and rule page.
2. Present the pages to the project lead.
